translated: Points of Controversy
The Great Fifty
The First Section
The Discussion of the Arousing of Mindfulness
Are all ideas the arousing of mindfulness?

original: Āmantā.🔽Sabbe dhammā sati satindriyaṁ satibalaṁ sammāsati satisambojjhaṅgo ekāyanamaggo khayagāmī🔽bodhagāmī apacayagāmī anāsavā asaṁyojaniyā aganthaniyā anoghaniyā ayoganiyā anīvaraṇiyā🔽aparāmaṭṭhā anupādāniyā asaṅkilesikā, sabbe dhammā buddhānussati dhammānussati saṅghānussati
analyzed: āmantā  sabbe dhammā sati sati indriyam sati balam sammāsati sati sambojjhaṅgaḥ ekāyana maggo khaya gāmī  bodha gāmī apacaya gāmī anāsavā a sayoja niyā a gantha niyā an ogha niyā a yoga niyā a nīvara niyā  aparāmaṭṭhā anupādāniyā asaṅkilesikā sabbe dhammā buddha anussati dhamma anussati saṅgha anussati
translated: “Yes.”

original: sīlānussati cāgānussati devatānussati ānāpānassati maraṇānussati kāyagatāsati upasamānussatīti?🔽Na hevaṁ vattabbe …pe….🔽Sabbe dhammā satipaṭṭhānāti?🔽Āmantā.🔽Cakkhāyatanaṁ satipaṭṭhānanti?🔽Na hevaṁ vattabbe …pe…🔽cakkhāyatanaṁ satipaṭṭhānanti?🔽Āmantā.🔽Cakkhāyatanaṁ sati satindriyaṁ satibalaṁ sammāsati satisambojjhaṅgo ekāyanamaggo
analyzed: sīla anussati cāga anussati devatā anussati ānāpāna ssati maraṇa anussati kāya gata asati upasama anussati iti 🔽na ha ivam vattabbe pe 🔽sabbe dhammā sati paṭṭhānā ti 🔽āmantā 🔽cakkhu āyatanam sati paṭṭhānan ti 🔽na ha ivam vattabbe pe 🔽cakkhu āyatanam sati paṭṭhānan ti 🔽āmantā 🔽cakkha āyatanam sati sati indriyam sati balam sammā sati sati sambojjhaṅgaḥ ekāyana maggo
translated: All ideas are mindfulness, the mindfulness faculty, the mindfulness power, right mindfulness, the mindfulness factor of complete awakening, the one-way path, the way leading to growth, the way to penetration, the way to enlightenment, the way to dispassion, the way to cessation, the way to peace, the way to direct knowledge, the way to self-awakening, the way to self-enlightenment, the way to self-enlightenedness, the way to self-awakening, the way to self-enlightenment, the way to self-enlightenedness, the way to self-awakening, the way to self-enlightenment, the way to self-enlightenedness, the way to self-awakening, the way to self-enlightenment, the way to self-enlightenedness, the way to self-awakening, the way to self-enlightenment, the way to self-enlightenedness, the way to self-awakening, the way to self-enlightenment, the way to self-enlightenedness, the way to self-awakening, the way to self-enlightenment, the way to self-enlightenedness, the way to self-awakening, the way to self-enlightenment, the way to self-enlightenedness, the way to self-awakening, the way to self-enlightenment, the way to self-enlightenedness, the way to self-awakening, the way to self-enlightenment, the way to self-enlightenedness, the way to self-awakening, the way to self-enlightenment, the way to self-enlightenedness, the way to self-awakening, the way to self-enlightenment, the way to self-enlightenedness, the way to self-awakening, the way to self-enlightenment, the way to self-enlightenedness, the way to self-awakening, the way to self-enlightenment, the way to self-enlightenedness, the way to self-awakening, the way to self-enlightenment, the way to self-enlightenedness, the way to

original: khayagāmī bodhagāmī apacayagāmī anāsavaṁ asaṁyojaniyaṁ …pe… asaṅkilesikaṁ, cakkhāyatanaṁ
analyzed: khaya gāmī bodha gāmī apacaya gāmī anāsavam a sayojaniyam pe a saṅkilesika
translated: the state that leads to destruction, the state that leads to knowledge, the state that leads to decrease, the taintless, the state that does not lead to bondage … the state that is not defiled, the eye sense-sphere …

original: buddhānussati dhammānussati saṅghānussati sīlānussati cāgānussati devatānussati ānāpānassati
analyzed: buddha anussati dhamma anussati saṅgha anussati sīla anussati cāga anussati devatā anussati ānāpāna ssati
translated: recollection of the Buddha, recollection of the Dhamma, recollection of the Saṅgha, recollection of virtue, recollection of generosity, recollection of the gods, mindfulness of breathing,

analyzed: maraṇa anussati kāyagata asati upasama anussati iti
translated: recollection of death, mindfulness occupied with the body, recollection of peace?”
“No, friend.”
The ear sense-sphere …🔽The nose sense-sphere …🔽The tongue sense-sphere …

analyzed: kāya āyatanam  rūpa āyatanam  sat dāyatanam
translated: The body sense-sphere …🔽The form sense-sphere …🔽The sound sense-sphere …
The odour sense-sphere …🔽The flavour sense-sphere …
The tangible sense-sphere …🔽Lust …
Aversion …
Conceit …🔽False view …
Scepticism …🔽Dullness …
Agitation …
Lack of shame …
Lack of fear of wrongdoing is a foundation of mindfulness?”
“No, friend.”

original: Anottappaṁ sati satindriyaṁ satibalaṁ sammāsati …pe… kāyagatāsati upasamānussatīti?
analyzed: anottappam sati sati indriyam sati balam sammā sati pe kāyagata asati upasama anussati iti
translated: Lack of fear of wrongdoing is a foundation of mindfulness, and that mindfulness is mindfulness?”
“Yes.”

analyzed: sati sati paṭṭhānā sā ca satī iti
translated: “Is mindfulness the foundation of mindfulness?”
“Yes.

analyzed: cakkhu āyatanam sati paṭṭhāna tat ca satī iti
translated: “Is the eye faculty a foundation of mindfulness, and is that mindfulness?”
“Is it so that the Blessed One has not declared the four noble truths?” …

analyzed: sati sati paṭṭhānā sā ca satī iti
translated: “Are mindfulness and the foundations of mindfulness the same?”
“Yes.”🔽“Is the ear faculty a foundation of mindfulness, and is that mindfulness?”

analyzed: kāya āyatanam rūpa āyatanam pe  phoṭṭhabba āyatanam rāgaḥ dosaḥ mohaḥ pe
translated: “Is the body faculty a foundation of mindfulness, and is that mindfulness?”🔽“Are form objects a foundation of mindfulness, and is that mindfulness?”🔽“Are tactile objects a foundation of mindfulness, and is that mindfulness?”🔽“Is lust a foundation of mindfulness, and is that mindfulness?”🔽“Is aversion a foundation of mindfulness, and is that mindfulness?”🔽“Is delusion a foundation of mindfulness, and is that mindfulness?”

analyzed: anottappam satipaṭṭhāna tat ca satī iti
translated: “Is lack of conscience a foundation of mindfulness, and is that mindfulness?”
“Is it so that the Blessed One has not declared the four noble truths?” …

analyzed: cakkhu āyatanam sati paṭṭhāna tat ca na sati iti
translated: “Is the eye faculty a foundation of mindfulness, and is that not mindfulness?”
“Yes.”

original: Sati satipaṭṭhānā, sā ca na satīti?
analyzed: sati sati paṭṭhānā sā ca na satī iti
translated: “Are mindfulness and the foundations of mindfulness the same, and is that not mindfulness?”

analyzed: na ha ivam vattabbe pe  sotāyatanam pe  kāya āyatanam
translated: “No.”🔽“Is the ear faculty a foundation of mindfulness, and is that not mindfulness?”
“Is the body faculty a foundation of mindfulness, and is that not mindfulness?”🔽“Are form objects a foundation of mindfulness, and is that not mindfulness?”
“Are tactile objects a foundation of mindfulness, and is that not mindfulness?”

“Is lust a foundation of mindfulness, and is that not mindfulness?”🔽“Is aversion a foundation of mindfulness, and is that not mindfulness?”🔽“Is delusion a foundation of mindfulness, and is that not mindfulness?”

analyzed: anottappam satipaṭṭhāna tat ca na sati iti
translated: “Is lack of conscience a foundation of mindfulness, and is that not mindfulness?”
“Yes.”

original: Sati satipaṭṭhānā, sā ca na satīti?🔽Na hevaṁ vattabbe …pe….
analyzed: sati sati paṭṭhānā sā ca na satī iti  na ha ivam vattabbe pe
translated: “Are mindfulness and the foundations of mindfulness the same, and is that not mindfulness?”🔽“No.”
It is not proper to say:
“All dhammas are foundations of mindfulness.”
“Yes.”

original: Nanu sabbe dhamme ārabbha sati santiṭṭhatīti?
analyzed: nanu sabbe dhamme ārabbha sati santiṭṭhati iti
translated: “But don’t you say that mindfulness is established with regard to all dhammas?”
“Yes.”

original: Hañci sabbe dhamme ārabbha sati santiṭṭhatīti, tena vata re vattabbe—🔽“sabbe dhammā satipaṭṭhānā”ti.
analyzed: hañci sabbe dhamme ārabbha sati santiṭṭhati iti tena vata re vattabbe  sabbe dhammā sati paṭṭhānā ti
translated: “Is it because mindfulness is established in regard to all ideas that it should be said:🔽‘All ideas are the establishment of mindfulness’?”

original: Sabbaṁ dhammaṁ ārabbha sati santiṭṭhatīti sabbe dhammā satipaṭṭhānāti?
analyzed: sabbam dhammam ārabbha sati santiṭṭhati iti sabbe dhammā sati paṭṭhānā ati
translated: “Is it because mindfulness is established in regard to all ideas that all ideas are the establishment of mindfulness?”
“Yes.”

original: Sabbaṁ dhammaṁ ārabbha phasso santiṭṭhatīti sabbe dhammā phassapaṭṭhānāti?
analyzed: sabbam dhammam ārabbha phassaḥ santiṭṭhati iti sabbe dhammā phassa paṭṭhānā ati
translated: “Is it because contact is established in regard to all ideas that all ideas are the establishment of contact?”
“That is not so.”

original: Sabbaṁ dhammaṁ ārabbha sati santiṭṭhatīti sabbe dhammā satipaṭṭhānāti?
analyzed: sabbam dhammam ārabbha sati santiṭṭhati iti sabbe dhammā sati paṭṭhānā ati
translated: “Is it because mindfulness is established in regard to all ideas that all ideas are the establishment of mindfulness?”

original: Āmantā.🔽Sabbaṁ dhammaṁ ārabbha vedanā santiṭṭhati …🔽saññā santiṭṭhati …
analyzed: āmantā  sabbam dhammam ārabbha vedanā santiṭṭhati  saññā santiṭṭhati
translated: “Yes.”🔽“Is it because feeling is established …🔽is it because perception is established …
is it because choice is established …

analyzed: cittam santiṭṭhati iti sabbe dhammā citta paṭṭhānā ti
translated: is it because consciousness is established in regard to all ideas that all ideas are the establishment of consciousness?”
“That is not so.”
“Are all ideas the establishment of mindfulness?”
“Yes.”

original: Sabbe sattā upaṭṭhitasatino satiyā samannāgatā satiyā samohitā;
analyzed: sabbe sattāḥ upaṭṭhita satino satiyā samannāgatā satiyā samohitā
translated: “Are all beings established in mindfulness, possessed of mindfulness, mindful?
Is mindfulness established for all beings?”
“That is not so.”
Are all dhammas the four establishments of mindfulness?
“Yes.”
“Hasn’t it been said by the Blessed One—

original: “amataṁ te, bhikkhave, na paribhuñjanti ye kāyagatāsatiṁ na paribhuñjanti.
analyzed: amatam te bhikkhave na paribhuñjanti ye kāya gata asatim na paribhuñjanti
translated: ‘Monks, those who don’t enjoy the enjoyment of the deathless don’t enjoy mindfulness of the body.

original: Amataṁ te, bhikkhave, paribhuñjanti ye kāyagatāsatiṁ paribhuñjantī”ti.
analyzed: amatam te bhikkhave paribhuñjanti ye kāya gata asatim paribhuñjanti iti
translated: Those who enjoy the enjoyment of the deathless enjoy mindfulness of the body’?
“Is there such a discourse?”
“Yes.”

original: Sabbe sattā kāyagatāsatiṁ paribhuñjanti paṭilabhanti āsevanti bhāventi bahulīkarontīti?
analyzed: sabbe sattā kāya gata asatim paribhuñjanti paṭilabhanti āsevanti bhāventi bahulīkaronti iti
translated: “Do all beings enjoy the enjoyment of mindfulness of the body, obtain it, develop it, and cultivate it?”
“That can’t be said.” …
Are all dhammas the four establishments of mindfulness?
“Yes.”

original: Nanu vuttaṁ bhagavatā—🔽“ekāyano ayaṁ, bhikkhave, maggo sattānaṁ visuddhiyā sokaparidevānaṁ samatikkamāya🔽dukkhadomanassānaṁ atthaṅgamāya ñāyassa adhigamāya nibbānassa sacchikiriyāya yadidaṁ
analyzed: nanu vuttam bhagavatā  eka ayanaḥ bhikkhave maggo sattānam visuddhiyā soka paridevānam samatikkamāya  dukkha domanassānaṃ atthaṅgamāya ñāyassa adhigamāya nibbānassa sacchikiriyāya yat idam
translated: “Hasn’t it been said by the Blessed One—

‘Monks, this is the direct path for the purification of beings, for the overcoming of sorrow and lamentation, for the disappearance of pain and distress, for the attainment of the right method, and for the realization of Unbinding—in other words, the four establishments of mindfulness’?
“Is there such a discourse?”
“Yes.”
“Are all dhammas the direct path?”
“That can’t be said.” …
Are all dhammas the four establishments of mindfulness?
Ānanda:
Has it not been said by the Blessed One:

original: “rañño, bhikkhave, cakkavattissa pātubhāvā sattannaṁ ratanānaṁ pātubhāvo hoti.🔽Katamesaṁ sattannaṁ?
analyzed: raññaḥ bhikkhave cakkavattissa pātubhāvā sattannam ratanānam pātubhāvaḥ hoti  katamesam sat tat na
translated: “With the appearance of a Wheel-turning Monarch, seven treasures appear:

original: Cakkaratanassa pātubhāvo hoti, hatthiratanassa pātubhāvo hoti, assaratanassa …🔽maṇiratanassa …
analyzed: cakka ratanassa pātubhāvaḥ hoti hatthi ratanassa pātubhāvaḥ hoti assa ratanassa  maṇi ratanassa
translated: the wheel treasure, the elephant treasure, the horse treasure,
the jewel treasure, the woman treasure,
the steward treasure, and the counselor treasure.

original: Rañño, bhikkhave, cakkavattissa pātubhāvā imesaṁ sattannaṁ ratanānaṁ pātubhāvo hoti.
analyzed: raññaḥ bhikkhave cakkavattissa pātubhāvā imesam sattannam ratanānam pātubhāvaḥ hoti
translated: With the appearance of a Wheel-turning Monarch, these seven treasures appear.

original: Tathāgatassa, bhikkhave, pātubhāvā arahato sammāsambuddhassa sattannaṁ bojjhaṅgaratanānaṁ pātubhāvo hoti.
analyzed: tathāgatassa bhikkhave pātubhāvā arahataḥ sammāsambuddhassa sattannam bojjhaṅga ratanānam pātubhāvaḥ hoti
translated: With the appearance of a Tathāgata, Arahant, Perfectly Enlightened One, seven treasures of awakening appear.
What are the seven?

analyzed: sati sambojjhaṅga ratanassa pātubhāvaḥ hoti dhammavicaya sambojjhaṅga ratanassa pātubhāvaḥ
translated: The treasure of the awakening factor of mindfulness, the treasure of the awakening factor of discrimination of phenomena,

original: hoti, vīriyasambojjhaṅgaratanassa pātubhāvo hoti, pītisambojjhaṅgaratanassa pātubhāvo🔽hoti, passaddhisambojjhaṅgaratanassa pātubhāvo hoti, samādhisambojjhaṅgaratanassa
analyzed: hoti vīriya sambojjhaṅga ratanassa pātubhāvaḥ hoti pīti sambojjhaṅga ratanassa pātubhāvaḥ  hoti passaddhi sambojjhaṅga ratanassa pātubhāvaḥ hoti samādhi sambojjhaṅga ratanassa
translated: the enlightenment factor of energy is a treasure, the enlightenment factor of rapture is a treasure,🔽the enlightenment factor of calm is a treasure, the enlightenment factor of concentration is a treasure,

analyzed: pātubhāvaḥ hoti upekkhā sambojjhaṅga ratanassa pātubhāvaḥ hoti
translated: the enlightenment factor of equanimity is a treasure.

original: Tathāgatassa, bhikkhave, pātubhāvā arahato sammāsambuddhassa imesaṁ sattannaṁ bojjhaṅgaratanānaṁ pātubhāvo hotī”ti.
analyzed: tathāgatassa bhikkhave pātubhāvāḥ arahataḥ sammāsambuddhassa imesam sattannam bojjhaṅga ratanānam pātubhāvaḥ hoti iti
translated: With the appearance of the Tathāgata, the Worthy One, the Perfect Sambuddha, these seven treasures of enlightenment appear.”
“Is there such a discourse?”
“Yes.”

original: Tathāgatassa pātubhāvā arahato sammāsambuddhassa sabbe dhammā satisambojjhaṅgaratanāva hontīti?
analyzed: tathāgatassa pātubhāvā arahataḥ sammāsambuddhassa sabbe dhammā sati sambojjhaṅga ratanā va honti iti
translated: “With the appearance of the Tathāgata, the Worthy One, the Perfect Sambuddha, are all dhammas a treasure of mindfulness?”
“Is it so that the Blessed One has not declared the four noble truths?” …
“Are all dhammas a foundation of mindfulness?”
“Yes.”
“Are all dhammas a right endeavour …
a basis of spiritual success …🔽a faculty …
a power …
an enlightenment factor?”
“Is it so that the Blessed One has not declared the four noble truths?” …
The Discussion of the Foundations of Mindfulness is finished.
